headline.main: IN MAMAMRONECK, A NEW TEACHING TOOL

docs.lead_paragraph: '' IT'S different from the classic classroom,'' Lisa Estreich said of ''Methods of Scientific Research,'' a science course offered at Mamaroneck High School. ''You don't have to use a pen or pencil and paper if you don't want to. You have a word processor and you can search throughout the whole country using data bases. You don't have to use books at all.'' The course, developed by Dr. Michael Franzblau in the early 1970's, enables qualified juniors and seniors to work on an original piece of scientific research of their own choosing and to follow it through all the steps that a professional scientist would pursue. ''The thing about doing science is that in most fields it really is a long way to the frontier, but in certain of the psychological sciences and the behavioral sciences and certain parts of biology, students can quickly get to the point where they are doing full- time research,'' Dr. Franzblau said.
